info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 18 at 4:17PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT PORTIONS OF BERKELEY COUNTY... ...MARINERS ON LAKE MOULTRIE SHOULD SEEK SAFE HARBOR... At 417 PM EDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm near Southern Lake Moultrie, or 9 miles west of Moncks Corner, moving southeast at 15 mph. HAZARD...up to penny sized hail. SOURCE...Radar Indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to plants, trees and crops is possible. Damage to windshields is unlikely. Some locations in the path of this storm include... Summerville, Moncks Corner, Ladson, and Cross. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<45 MPH
info.instruction: Boaters on Lake Moultrie should seek safe harbor immediately. If caught on the open water, stay as low as possible and wear a personal flotation device. Remember, if you can hear thunder you are at risk for being struck by lightning. Report damage directly to the Charleston National Weather Service at 888-383-2024 when it is safe to do so. You can also email your report to nws.charlestonsc@noaa.gov.
